title: Ovzon gets another deadline extension to deploy first GEO satellite
summary: International regulators have given Ovzon another six months to provide services from its debut satellite following a series of manufacturing and launch delays for the project, the Swedish satcoms provider announced Oct. 31.

title: FAA completes safety review for next Starship launch
summary: SpaceX is one step closer to getting an updated license for its next Starship launch but must still wait for the completion of an environmental review.

title: SES says O3b mPower electrical issues are worse than thought
summary: Electrical issues disclosed a few months ago on the first four O3b mPower satellites in medium Earth orbit will significantly reduce their operational life and broadband capacity, their operator SES announced Oct. 31.

title: HawkEye 360 gets U.S. Navy contract for maritime surveillance in the Pacific
summary: HawkEye 360, a commercial operator of remote-sensing satellites won a $12.2 million contract from the U.S. Navy’s Naval Information Warfare Center Pacific.

title: Space Force assigns 21 national security missions to ULA and SpaceX
summary: The Space Systems Command announced 21 launch missions have been assigned to United Launch Alliance and SpaceX as part of the National Security Space Launch (NSSL) Phase 2 contract the companies won in 2020.

title: Autonomous Servicing Will Help Realize a Dynamic Future with Cosmic Implications
summary: In-space servicing, assembly, and manufacturing (ISAM) capabilities will eventually be crucial enablers of securing and sustaining the future space economy. However, they have not fully matured or become mainstream in the two decades since Orbital Express.

title: Scientists will soon find out whether the Lucy mission works as intended
summary: On Wednesday, the spacecraft will come close to the small asteroid Dinkinesh.

title: Astrobotic lander arrives at launch site
summary: Astrobotic’s first lunar lander has arrived in Florida for final preparations for launch on Christmas Eve.

title: Multiverse Media and SpaceNews to Merge
summary: DENVER – October 31, 2023 – Multiverse Media Inc, a Denver-based integrated media company that Educates, Informs and Inspires the space community across multiple professional and enthusiast brands, is proud […]

title: Daily Telescope: A spooky image of the Solar System’s largest planet
summary: What's big and has a lot of gravity, but won't cause a cavity?
